text: どうして日本人は床の上で寝られるのかしら? / 信じらんない!
translation: How can Japanese people sleep on the floor? / I can't believe it!
grammar: 寝られる uses potential form られる indicating ability. のかしら is a feminine sentence ending expressing wonder or puzzlement.

text: 自分だって子供のくせ
translation: She's a child herself, though.
grammar: くせに (often written くせ when sentence ends) expresses criticism - 'even though/despite being X'. だって emphasizes 'also/too'.

text: 君の唇と君の言葉、どっちを信用したらいいのかな?
translation: Your lips and your words - which should I believe?
grammar: 〜たらいいのかな uses conditional たら + いい (should) + のかな (wondering/uncertain question). Creates a contemplative tone.

text: はい。
translation: Yes.
grammar: Simple affirmative response.

text: ありがとう。今日は珍しくシラフじゃない? / うーん。どっちね、仕事?それとも男? / いろいろ。 / う / ーん。
translation: Thank you. You're unusually sober today, aren't you? / Hmm. Which is it - work? Or a man? / Various things. / Hmm.
grammar: 珍しく uses adverbial form of い-adjective (〜く). じゃない is casual negative copula used as tag question here.

text: まだ好きなのかしら? / え、変なこと言わないでよ!誰が、あんな奴と。
translation: I wonder if she still likes him? / Huh? Don't say weird things! Who would, with that guy...
grammar: のかしら is feminine wondering expression. 〜ないでよ is casual negative request ('don't do X'). Sentence trails off implying denial.

text: いくら若気のいたりとはいえ、あんなのと付き合っていたなんて、我が人生最大の汚点だ / わ。 / 私が言ったのはカジ君がよ / 動揺させちゃった? / あんたねえ
translation: Even if it was youthful indiscretion, the fact that I dated someone like that is the biggest stain on my life. / I was talking about Kaji. / Did I upset you? / Hey, you...
grammar: いくら〜とはいえ means 'even though/although'. 〜ていた is past progressive. 〜ちゃった is casual contraction of てしまった (completed action).

text: 怒るのはズボシをつかれた証拠よ
translation: Getting angry is proof that I hit the mark.
grammar: 〜のは nominalizes the verb (turning 'to get angry' into 'getting angry'). 〜をつかれた is passive form ('to be hit with').

text: 今度はもう少し素直になったら? / 8年前とは違うんだから / 変わってないわ / ちっとも / 大人になってない / さて / しごとしごと
translation: Why don't you be a bit more honest this time? / It's different from 8 years ago. / You haven't changed at all. / Not one bit. / You haven't become an adult. / Well then / work, work.
grammar: 〜たら? is casual suggestion ('why don't you'). んだから gives reason/explanation. ちっとも requires negative verb to mean 'not at all'.

text: 明日は決戦だもんね
translation: Tomorrow is the decisive battle, after all.
grammar: だもんね is casual contraction of だものね, expressing shared understanding or seeking agreement ('after all/you know').

text: 目標はゴーラ絶対防衛戦を突破 / 来たわね / 今度は抜かりないわよ
translation: The target has broken through the absolute defense line at Gora. / Here it comes. / This time there won't be any slip-ups.
grammar: 〜を突破 uses を particle with する verb (突破する). 抜かりない means 'there are no oversights' (抜かり + ない).

text: 音楽スタートと同時にATフィールドを展開 / あとは作戦通りに / 2人ともいいわね / 了解 / 目標は三冠振入 / いいわね
translation: Deploy the AT Field simultaneously with the music start. / After that, follow the operation plan. / Both of you, understood? / Roger. / Target is entering Sangai Valley. / Understood?
grammar: 〜と同時に means 'simultaneously with'. 〜通りに means 'according to/following'. いいわね seeks confirmation.

text: 最初からフルカド、最大戦速で行くわよ! / 分かってるよ。62秒で蹴りを / つける。 / 目標!ゼロ地点に到達します!
translation: We're going full throttle from the start, at maximum combat speed! / I know. We'll finish it in 62 seconds. / Target! Reaching zero point!
grammar: 〜から means 'from'. で indicates means/method. 蹴りをつける is idiom meaning 'to finish/settle something'.

text: 外電源、パーディング。発進。
translation: External power, purging. Launch.
grammar: Technical/military terminology. Short declarative statements typical of operation commands.

text: エヴァリオキ確認!
translation: Eva startup confirmed!
grammar: リオキ is likely 起動 (きどう) in katakana/garbled. 確認 used as noun in technical context.

text: おーちゃー! / うざまね
translation: Oh no! / Same here!
grammar: Exclamatory expressions. うざまね appears to be colloquial/slurred speech.

text: ちょっと! / あたしの2号機になんてことすんなよ!
translation: Hey! / What are you doing to my Unit-02!
grammar: なんてことすんなよ is rough/casual speech: なんてこと (what kind of thing) + する (do) + な (don't) + よ (emphasis). Masculine ending.

text: そんな!そっちがつかがってきたんじゃないか! / 最後にタイミング外したの!そっちでしょ! / 普段からポケポケっとしてるからよ! / 昨日の夜だって寝ないで何してたの?
translation: That's not true! You're the one who grabbed on! / You're the one who missed the timing at the end! / It's because you're always spacing out! / What were you doing last night instead of sleeping?
grammar: 〜んじゃないか is assertive ('isn't it that...'). 〜でしょ seeks agreement. 〜からよ gives reason with feminine ending. だって emphasizes 'even'.

text: 今日も戦いのためのイメージトライニング / だよ! / 嘘ばっかし!寝てるスキンに私のくつける奪おうとしたくせに! / つるいよ!起きてたなんて! / ひどーい! / 冗談で言った
translation: Image training for today's battle! / You're such a liar! You tried to steal my lips while I was sleeping! / That's mean! You were awake! / How terrible! / I said it as a joke.
grammar: 〜ばっかし is casual form of ばかり ('nothing but'). 〜スキンに means 'while/when'. 〜くせに means 'even though/despite'. 〜なんて expresses disbelief.

text: だけなのに本当だったの?キスしたのね! / してないよ!途中でやめたんだよ!
translation: It was just that, but was it true? You kissed her! / I didn't! I stopped midway!
grammar: 〜だけなのに means 'even though it was just'. 〜のね seeks confirmation with surprise. 〜んだよ explains/emphasizes ('I'm telling you').

text: 部下直前の使徒が眠る浅間さん加工 / 極地仕様のエヴァ2号機が灼熱の地獄へ挑む
translation: The angel sleeping in Mt. Asama just before hatching. / The polar-spec Eva Unit-02 challenges the scorching hell.
grammar: 〜直前 means 'just before'. が marks subject. 〜へ挑む means 'to challenge/take on'.

text: 次回マグマダイバー / この次もサービスサービス
translation: Next episode: Magma Diver. / Next time, service, service!
grammar: Standard preview format. サービス repeated for emphasis - refers to 'fan service' content.

text: ご視聴ありがとうございました
translation: Thank you for watching.

vocabulary.word: ありがとうございました
vocabulary.reading: ありがとうございました

grammar: ご〜 is honorific prefix. 〜ました is polite past form. Standard end-of-broadcast phrase.
